q_geo_001.question: What is the capital of France?
q_geo_001.hint: This city is famous for the Eiffel Tower.
q_geo_001.explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since the late 10th century.

q_geo_002.question: Which is the largest ocean on Earth?
q_geo_002.explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers approximately 63 million square miles.

q_geo_003.question: Which country has the longest coastline in the world?
q_geo_003.hint: This country shares the world's longest land border with the USA.
q_geo_003.explanation: Canada has over 202,080 km of coastline.

q_geo_004.question: What is the capital of Australia?
q_geo_004.hint: It was purpose-built as the capital and is not the largest city.
q_geo_004.explanation: Canberra was selected as the capital in 1908 as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

q_geo_005.question: Which river flows through the most countries?
q_geo_005.hint: This river flows through 10 European countries including Germany and Austria.
q_geo_005.explanation: The Danube flows through 10 countries in Europe.

q_geo_100.question: What is the highest mountain in the world?
q_geo_100.hint: Located in the Himalayas on the border of Nepal and Tibet.
q_geo_100.explanation: Mount Everest stands at 8,849 meters (29,032 feet) above sea level.

q_geo_006.question: Which desert is the largest hot desert in the world?
q_geo_006.hint: This African desert is almost as large as the entire United States.
q_geo_006.explanation: The Sahara Desert covers approximately 9.2 million square kilometers across North Africa.

q_geo_007.question: What is the smallest country in the world by area?
q_geo_007.hint: This country is located entirely within the city of Rome.
q_geo_007.explanation: Vatican City covers only 0.44 square kilometers and is the headquarters of the Roman Catholic Church.

q_geo_008.question: Which strait separates Europe from Asia?
q_geo_008.hint: This narrow waterway runs through the city of Istanbul.
q_geo_008.explanation: The Bosphorus strait divides Istanbul and separates European Turkey from Asian Turkey.

q_geo_009.question: What is the longest river in South America?
q_geo_009.hint: This river carries more water than any other river and flows through the world's largest rainforest.
q_geo_009.explanation: The Amazon River stretches approximately 6,400 km and has the largest discharge of any river.

q_geo_010.question: Which country has the most time zones?
q_geo_010.hint: Its overseas territories span across the globe from the Caribbean to the Pacific.
q_geo_010.explanation: France has 12 time zones due to its overseas territories, more than any other country including Russia's 11.

q_geo_011.question: What is the driest continent on Earth?
q_geo_011.hint: Despite being covered in ice, this continent receives very little precipitation.
q_geo_011.explanation: Antarctica is technically a desert, receiving less than 200 mm of precipitation per year on average.

q_geo_012.question: Which European country is shaped like a boot?
q_geo_012.hint: This country is a peninsula extending into the Mediterranean Sea.
q_geo_012.explanation: Italy's distinctive boot shape is one of the most recognizable country outlines in the world.

q_geo_013.question: What is the longest mountain range in the world?
q_geo_013.hint: This mountain range stretches along the western coast of South America.
q_geo_013.explanation: The Andes stretch over 7,000 km through seven South American countries, making it the longest continental mountain range.

q_geo_014.question: Which country has the most pyramids in the world?
q_geo_014.hint: This African country has over 200 pyramids, more than its famous northern neighbor.
q_geo_014.explanation: Sudan has approximately 255 pyramids, built by the ancient Nubian kingdoms of Kush, compared to Egypt's roughly 138.
